intro: Lunasia mollis, commonly known as the soft moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its delicate, white, star-shaped flowers that open at night. The plant produces small, round berries that turn from green to red as they mature. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a slightly velvety texture. Lunasia mollis is often grown for its ornamental value and is adapted to thrive in warm, humid climates.
